topic.title: Install the HPE Helion Development Platform

section.p: The installation procedure has changed significantly since the last release. The HDP Installer 2.0, also known as HDPI, is a plugin for the the python-openstackclient (OSC). It is able to leverage the authentication, configuration and command line option parsing that is already part of OSC to greatly simplify the installation process.

p.note: You must have satisfied all prerequisites before beginning installation.

section.title: Download the Latest Version of HPE Helion Development Platform Installation Client
section.p: The installation is provided as a small compressed tar file. The images for the individual services will be downloaded during each service installation.

ol.li: Navigate to the HPE Helion Download Network (HDN) and log in. If necessary, create an account first.
Download the Development Platform Installer 2.0.0.0 beta package.

section.title: Install the HPE Helion Development Platform Installation Client
section.note: Do not source service.osrc, keystone.osrc, or any other *rc file before you begin.

ol.li: SSH to the HPE Helion OpenStack Deployer.
Check to ensure that all Keystone AUTH_URL IP addresses have been added to the no-proxy list.
Check to ensure that all OS_ variables are unset. To check this, run env | grep OSX_ and then unset any OS_ variables which appear in the list of results.

Create and source the Virtual Environment. In this example, <dpi-venv>.tgz is the name of the installer.mkdir -p /opt/stack/venv/<dpi-venv> tar -C /opt/stack/venv/<dpi-venv> -xzf <dpi-venv>.tgz source /opt/stack/venv/<dpi-venv>/bin/activate
Test the installation by retrieving a list of installable files. The --debug option will return information vital for troubleshooting, if necessary.openstack hdpi --os-cloud mycloud hdpi list --debug
